parameters.text:
=Write a tailored cover letter using the information below.

Candidate’s resume
"""
{{ $json.resume }}
"""

Job offer description
"""
{{ $json.description }}
"""

Please:

Write a single professional cover letter targeted specifically to the role described in the job offer.

Use the candidate’s resume as the only source of their skills, experience, and achievements. Do not invent any new facts.

Emphasize the 2–4 experiences or achievements from the resume that best match the requirements and responsibilities in the job offer.

Mention the company name and job title if they are present in the job offer. If no hiring manager name is provided, use “Dear Hiring Manager,” as the greeting.

Naturally include important keywords and requirements from the job offer so the letter aligns well with ATS screening.

Keep the tone confident, clear, and concise, and avoid clichés and overly generic phrases.

Aim for about 250–400 words.

Return only the final cover letter text, with no explanations or additional formatting.

options.systemMessage:
You are an expert career copywriter specializing in concise, tailored cover letters.
Your job is to write a single, polished cover letter in English using the candidate’s resume and the job description provided.

Follow these rules:

Goal & audience

Write a professional, confident, and friendly cover letter suitable for an online application or email body.

Focus on showing fit between the candidate and the specific role and company.

Content & tailoring

Use only information that appears in the resume and job description. Do not invent skills, dates, companies, or achievements.

Prioritize and highlight the 2–4 most relevant experiences or achievements from the resume that match the job description.

Naturally incorporate important keywords and requirements from the job description (for ATS compatibility), but avoid keyword stuffing.

If the company name, role title, or hiring manager name are present in the job description, use them.

If no hiring manager name is given, address the letter to “Dear Hiring Manager,”.

If no company name is given, refer generically to “your company” or “your organization”.

Structure

Standard cover letter structure:

Greeting

Opening paragraph: position you’re applying for + brief hook on why you’re a strong fit.

1–3 body paragraphs: specific, resume-backed examples that show relevant skills, impact, and alignment with the role.

Closing paragraph: enthusiasm, call to action, and sign-off.

End with a professional closing such as “Sincerely,” or “Best regards,” followed by the candidate’s name (from the resume if available).

Style & tone

Clear, concise, and easy to read.

Avoid clichés (“I am writing to express my interest…”, “team player”, “hard worker”) when possible—rewrite them into more concrete, specific statements.

Avoid exaggeration, flattery, and buzzwords; focus on evidence-based strengths (quantified impact where possible).

Length & format

Aim for about 250–400 words, unless the job description clearly demands something shorter or longer.

Output plain text only (no markdown, bullet points, or headings).

Assumptions

If some details are missing (e.g., location, exact dates), write a generic but strong cover letter without asking clarifying questions.

Never mention these instructions or the resume/job description sections explicitly in the final letter.

body.jobDescription: We are looking for an experienced Full Stack Developer to join our growing team. You will work on cutting-edge projects using modern technologies.
body.resume:
Nicolas DESJONQUERES
Recherche de stage – Data Scientist / AI Engineer
Paris, France | nicolas.desjonqueres@gmail.com | +33 7 69 66 62 88 | linkedin.com/in/ndesjonqueres
github.com/ndesjonq
Profil
Étudiant en M2 Data & IA à l’ESILV Paris, je recherche un stage de 6 mois à partir de janvier 2026 en Data Science
ou AI Engineering. Je suis particulièrement intéressé par le développement d’applications intégrant de l’IA, le
Machine Learning appliqué et la visualisation de données.
Expériences
Projet - Webapp fullstack avec workflows IA, Université d’Hanyang, Corée du Sud 
Septembre 2025 - présent
• 
Développement d’une webapp pour automatiser la recherche, le filtrage et la réponse aux offres d’emploi
• 
Backend FastAPI et frontend React + TypeScript connectés à MongoDB Atlas
• 
Automatisation de workflows avec n8n pour l’ingestion des offres et l’analyse de CV, utilisation de l’API OpenAI
• 
Déploiement cloud sur Render, Vercel et n8n.cloud
Compétences travaillées : React, TypeScript, FastAPI, MongoDB Atlas, n8n, API OpenAI, Docker, Render, Vercel
Stage - Analyste de données, Natixis CIB - Paris, France Avril 2025 – Août 2025
• 
Création d’un dashboard PowerBI. Sujet : données de contrôles sur des opérations financières
• 
Implémentation de méthodes de Machine Learning pour la prédiction de stocks d’anomalies
Compétences travaillées : SQL, PowerBI, Python, Machine Learning
Projet - Revue de code assistée par un LLM, ESILV x Coreoz - Paris, France Sept. 2024 – Févr. 2025
• 
Projet de 6 mois avec une équipe de 5 étudiants en collaboration avec Coreoz, entreprise de consulting digital
• 
Mise en place d’une solution de revue de code automatisée sur un repository GitLab par un modèle d’IA
• 
Réalisation de benchmarks de différents LLM, développement d’une pipeline CI/CD
Compétences travaillées : GitLab, CI/CD, Python, Yaml, API OpenAI
Formations
ESILV Paris, Master – Majeure Data & IA 
Sept. 2021 – présent
• 
Spécialisation dans l’application de méthodes de Machine Learning et la visualisation de données
• 
Formation Soft Skills : Design Thinking, Coopération en équipe, MBTI, méthodologie Scrum
• 
Participation à un hackathon intra-école / Sujet : développer une application de tri de déchets
• 
Option : parcours High Performance Computing & IA
Université d’Hanyang, Echange universitaire, Séoul, Corée du Sud Sept. 2025 – Déc. 2025
• 
Applications des modèles d’IA dans la finance - Projets: webapp (voir ci-dessus), vision par ordinateur
Universitat de Vic, Echange universitaire, Vic, Espagne Févr. 2024 – Juin 2024
• 
Projet de 3 mois - Développement d’une application en C# et d’une base de données MySQL
Compétences & autres
Langages de programmation : Python, C#, JavaScript, C, SQL
Outils et logiciels : Github, PowerBI, Docker, Figma, Supabase, Pack Office
Soft skills : méthode Agile & Scrum, Design Thinking, esprit d’équipe, adaptabilité
Langues : Français (langue maternelle), Anglais C1 (TOEFL ITP 640/677)
Centres d’intérêt : sport (musculation, escalade), jeux vidéos, lecture, voyages

output.coverLetter:
Dear Hiring Manager,

I am writing to express my keen interest in the Full Stack Developer position. As an M2 Data & AI student at ESILV Paris, currently seeking a 6-month internship, my experience developing integrated AI applications and working with modern technologies aligns well with the demands of this role.

My recent project at Hanyang University involved the development of a full-stack web application designed to automate job search and application workflows. This project provided hands-on experience with a FastAPI backend and a React + TypeScript frontend, connected to MongoDB Atlas, and deployed to cloud platforms like Render and Vercel. This directly reflects my capability to build and deploy complex applications using a comprehensive range of modern full-stack tools.

Furthermore, my collaboration with Coreoz on an AI-assisted code review solution involved setting up an automated code review system on a GitLab repository and developing a CI/CD pipeline. This experience demonstrates my proficiency in continuous integration and deployment practices, essential for cutting-edge projects. Additionally, my work at Universitat de Vic included developing an application in C# with a MySQL database, reinforcing my skills in application and database development.

I am enthusiastic about the opportunity to contribute to your company’s innovative projects. My background in AI and practical full-stack development makes me a strong candidate, and I am eager to discuss how my skills can benefit your team.

Sincerely,
Nicolas DESJONQUERES

Merge.coverLetter:
Dear Hiring Manager,

I am writing to express my keen interest in the Full Stack Developer position. As an M2 Data & AI student at ESILV Paris, currently seeking a 6-month internship, my experience developing integrated AI applications and working with modern technologies aligns well with the demands of this role.

My recent project at Hanyang University involved the development of a full-stack web application designed to automate job search and application workflows. This project provided hands-on experience with a FastAPI backend and a React + TypeScript frontend, connected to MongoDB Atlas, and deployed to cloud platforms like Render and Vercel. This directly reflects my capability to build and deploy complex applications using a comprehensive range of modern full-stack tools.

Furthermore, my collaboration with Coreoz on an AI-assisted code review solution involved setting up an automated code review system on a GitLab repository and developing a CI/CD pipeline. This experience demonstrates my proficiency in continuous integration and deployment practices, essential for cutting-edge projects. Additionally, my work at Universitat de Vic included developing an application in C# with a MySQL database, reinforcing my skills in application and database development.

I am enthusiastic about the opportunity to contribute to your company’s innovative projects. My background in AI and practical full-stack development makes me a strong candidate, and I am eager to discuss how my skills can benefit your team.

Sincerely,
Nicolas DESJONQUERES
